publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-1636.1 Stewart Stevenson: A Tolerance-Free Parliament?—As an amendment to motion (S2M-1636) in the name of Mr Brian Monteith, leave out from "the majority" to end and insert "smokers are victims of a vile trade which promotes this addiction, and believes that individuals should receive support to overcome this in a way that is supportive, sympathetic and effective." Supported by: Mr Stewart Maxwell*, Rob Gibson*

S2M-1636.1 Stewart Stevenson: A Tolerance-Free Parliament?—As an amendment to motion (S2M-1636) in the name of Mr Brian Monteith, leave out from "the majority" to end and insert "smokers are victims of a vile trade which promotes this addiction, and believes that individuals should receive support to overcome this in a way that is supportive, sympathetic and effective." Supported by: Mr Stewart Maxwell, Rob Gibson
S2M-1636.1 A Tolerance-Free Parliament? (lodged on 6 September 2004) Frances Curran*
